showScoreExcerpt: "Every song enhances the hilarity, expert staging heightens every gag, and the cast of fresh faces is blissfully good. Broadway hasn’t seen anything like it since Mel Brooks came to town with “The Producers,” only “Mormon” has better songs."

keyPhrases.quote: Broadway hasn't seen anything like it since Mel Brooks came to town with "The Producers," only "Mormon" has better songs
Every song enhances the hilarity, expert staging heightens every gag
the cast of fresh faces is blissfully good

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Unqualified praise across all elements with superlative comparisons to Broadway classics and emphatic language like 'blissfully good' and 'expert staging' signals a clear rave recommendation. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses unqualified enthusiasm with superlatives and strong comparisons, indicating a must-see production.
